apps.title: Scarlet Portfolio
apps.content:
The stars floating in the background of this webpage are not a video, but rather 5,000 stars randomly placed and rendered in real-time. About 15% of them are colored stars, adding vibrancy to the background.
The source code is publicly available on GitHub, so please take a look if you're interested.

apps.title: Sugoi Mojisu Counter
apps.content:
You can count the characters you input.
You can set a target number of characters and visualize how close you are to the target.
It also has AI that provides free advice on the text you input.

apps.title: Tire Quotation App
apps.content:
I developed this as an internal app after hearing from the president of a local car company that creating quotations in Excel every time was a hassle.
By pre-entering tire information into a database and performing conditional searches, anyone can create quotations with the same quality without making mistakes in the amount.

apps.title: Menhera Todo
apps.content: “Menhera todo” is an app that won first prize at a hackathon with the theme “Goofy Todo App.” You manage tasks alongside a needy girl named Hera-chan: completing tasks raises her affection, while neglecting or deleting them lowers it—eventually triggering a “bad end” with forced account deletion. It’s chaotic but just about usable.

apps.title: Paradia
apps.content: Paradia is an SNS-style app that won first prize at the Supporters Geek Sai Hackathon. It’s built on a theme of contradiction: on the surface it looks like a happy utopia, but behind the scenes it’s a dark world with complete information control. Every post is checked and rewritten by the AI “Ordina,” and any negative content is erased. A simple, clear UI pulls users into this unique setting immediately.

About.title: About Me
About.content:
I'm a web engineer focused on developing web applications. I primarily use React, Next.js, and TypeScript to create user-friendly applications.
I enjoy coding as a hobby while also taking on freelance projects and have experience launching a SaaS product at a startup. I'm always exploring new technologies and striving to build better products.
I have published the app I developed on GitHub, so feel free to check it out!
